oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Efficacy of Monensin Sodium for the Reduction of Fecal Shedding of Mycobacterium avium subsp paratuberculosis in Infected Dairy Cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hendrick, S. H.
Kelton, D. F.
Leslie, K. E.
Lissemore, K. D.
Archambault, M.
Bagg, R.
Dick, P.
Duffield, T. F.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mycobacterium avium paratuberculosis
Johne's disease
monensin sodium
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reducing the quantity of Mycobacterium avium subsp paratuberculosis (MAP) being shed by cows with Johne's disease should decrease the risk of spread of this disease to young stock. Previous work has suggested that monensin sodium decreases the pathologic lesions associated with Johne's disease, but the impact on shedding of viable MAP remains unknown.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 167
